trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of a <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollectionType"></xref> object.
This enumeration contains all the possible return values for the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.CollectionType%2A> property.
It is used by the configuration system during run time to correctly merge configuration settings.
It is also used when creating a custom class that extends <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection>.
By default, the type of a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection> object is AddRemoveClearMap.

If a BasicMap is required, override the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollectionType.AddRemoveClearMap> property when extending <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollectionType.BasicMap>.
Collections of this type contain elements that can be merged across a hierarchy of configuration files.
At any particular level within such a hierarchy, `add`, `remove`, and `clear` directives are used to modify any inherited properties and specify new ones.

Same as <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollectionType.AddRemoveClearMap"></xref>, except that this type causes the <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection"></xref> object to sort its contents such that inherited elements are listed last.
Collections of this type contain elements that apply to the level at which they are specified, and to all child levels.
A child level cannot modify the properties specified by a parent element of this type.

Same as <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollectionType.BasicMap"></xref>, except that this type causes the <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection"></xref> object to sort its contents such that inherited elements are listed last.
